triples.name: Replicator equation
triples.relevance: The paper introduces the replicator dynamics for symmetric and asymmetric games with metric space strategy sets.

triples.name: Symmetric game
triples.relevance: The paper develops replicator dynamics specifically for symmetric games where payoffs depend only on strategies employed.

triples.name: Game theory
triples.relevance: The paper applies game-theoretic concepts to analyze evolutionary dynamics and strategic interactions.

triples.name: Metric space
triples.relevance: The paper extends replicator dynamics by allowing strategy sets to be metric spaces with distance functions.

triples.name: Banach space
triples.relevance: The paper provides a framework where replicator dynamics evolves in a Banach space of finite signed measures.

triples.name: Nash equilibrium
triples.relevance: The paper establishes a relation between Nash equilibria and the stability of replicator dynamics.

triples.name: Oligopoly
triples.relevance: The paper applies its framework to oligopoly models as an application domain.

triples.name: International trade
triples.relevance: The paper applies its framework to international trade models as an application domain.

triples.name: Public good
triples.relevance: The paper applies its framework to public good models as an application domain.

triples.name: Tragedy of the commons
triples.relevance: The paper applies its framework to analyze the tragedy of commons as an application domain.

triples.name: War of attrition (game)
triples.relevance: The paper applies its framework to analyze the war of attrition game as an application domain.

triples.name: Markov chain
triples.relevance: The paper provides conditions to approximate replicator dynamics using measure-valued Markov processes.

triples.name: Dynamical system
triples.relevance: The paper provides conditions to approximate replicator dynamics using finite-dimensional dynamical systems.

triples.name: Evolutionary game theory
triples.relevance: The paper develops replicator dynamics within the framework of evolutionary game theory.
